verses.text_plain: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?
verses.verse_html: 1Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?

verses.text_plain: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.
verses.verse_html:
2Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof. ▼
▼ feed…: or, feed them

footnotes.body_html: ▼ feed…: or, feed them

verses.text_plain: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.
verses.verse_html: 3They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.

verses.text_plain: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.
verses.verse_html: 4They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.

verses.text_plain: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.
verses.verse_html: 5Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.

verses.text_plain: They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.
verses.verse_html:
6They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked. ▼
▼ corn: Heb. mingled corn, or, dredge
 , ▼
▼ they gather…: Heb. the wicked gather the vintage

footnotes.body_text: ▼ corn: Heb. mingled corn, or, dredge
footnotes.body_html: ▼ corn: Heb. mingled corn, or, dredge

footnotes.body_text: ▼ they gather…: Heb. the wicked gather the vintage
footnotes.body_html: ▼ they gather…: Heb. the wicked gather the vintage

verses.text_plain: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.
verses.verse_html: 7They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.

verses.text_plain: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
verses.verse_html: 8They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.

verses.text_plain: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.
verses.verse_html: 9They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.

verses.text_plain: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;
verses.verse_html: 10They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;

verses.text_plain: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.
verses.verse_html: 11Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.

verses.text_plain: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly to them.
verses.verse_html: 12Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly to them.

verses.text_plain: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.
verses.verse_html: 13They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.

tokens.text: They are of those that rebel

verses.text_plain: The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.
verses.verse_html: 14The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.

verses.text_plain: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face.
verses.verse_html:
15The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face. ▼
▼ disguiseth…: Heb. setteth his face in secret

footnotes.body_text: ▼ disguiseth…: Heb. setteth his face in secret
footnotes.body_html: ▼ disguiseth…: Heb. setteth his face in secret

verses.text_plain: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.
verses.verse_html: 16In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.

verses.text_plain: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.
verses.verse_html: 17For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.

verses.text_plain: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.
verses.verse_html: 18He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.

verses.text_plain: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so doth the grave those which have sinned.
verses.verse_html:
19Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so doth the grave those which have sinned. ▼
▼ consume: Heb. violently take

footnotes.body_html: ▼ consume: Heb. violently take

verses.text_plain: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
verses.verse_html: 20The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.

tokens.text: on him; he shall be no more remembered

verses.text_plain: He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.
verses.verse_html: 21He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.

verses.text_plain: He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.
verses.verse_html:
22He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life. ▼
▼ no…: or, he trusteth not his own life

footnotes.body_text: ▼ no…: or, he trusteth not his own life
footnotes.body_html: ▼ no…: or, he trusteth not his own life

verses.text_plain: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.
verses.verse_html: 23Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.

verses.text_plain: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.
verses.verse_html:
24They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn. ▼
▼ are gone: Heb. are not
 , ▼
▼ taken…: Heb. closed up

tokens.text: but are gone and brought low

footnotes.body_html: ▼ are gone: Heb. are not
▼ taken…: Heb. closed up

verses.text_plain: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?
verses.verse_html: 25And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?
